recipe.title: How to Make Udon
recipe.intro: Udon are thick Japanese noodles. They are soft and chewy in hot soup.
recipe.ingredients: udon noodles, dashi stock, soy sauce, mirin, salt, green onion, kamaboko (fish cake), egg
steps: **Boil** water in a big pot and cook the udon noodles.
**Make** the soup by mixing dashi stock, soy sauce, mirin, and salt in another pot.
**Heat** the soup on medium heat until it is hot.
**Drain** the udon noodles and put them in bowls.
**Pour** the hot soup over the noodles.
**Add** green onion, fish cake, and an egg on top. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I visited Botanical Bowl in Glebe on a rainy day. The restaurant was near a big park with many trees. Inside, it was warm and cozy. There were pink cushions on the chairs. I ordered hot udon with egg and fish cake. The noodles were thick and chewy. The soup was so warm and comforting. Soft jazz music was playing. It was a perfect rainy day lunch.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Hi, are you OK? You look sick.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: I have a cold. My throat hurts.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Oh no. I will make udon for you.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: It is Japanese thick noodles in hot soup.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: That sounds nice. Is it easy to eat?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Yes! The noodles are soft and the soup is warm.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: That is just what I need.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: I will also put an egg in it. Eggs are good for you.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Thank you so much. You are very kind.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Here you go! Please eat it while it is hot.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Wow, this is so good. I feel better already!
